definition: to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: Sharks cruised toward her lone figure, only to be driven away by rifle shots.
sentences.chinese: 鲨鱼游向她孤单的身躯，只能靠来复枪来击退。

sentences.english: The hero beat back ten enemies with his long sword.
sentences.chinese: 那个英雄用他的长剑击退了十个对手。

sentences.english: This helps fight off the urge to curl back up under the blankets and fall back asleep.
sentences.chinese: 这能帮你击退缩回毛毯下睡觉的强烈欲望。

sentences.english: A piece that is dislodged has no effect on the spaceprovince from which the mover came that dislodged it.
sentences.chinese: 被击退的单位对发起进攻的省份没有任何影响。

sentences.english: The beleaguered Jedi Knights fought valiantly to repulse the Mandalorian marauders.
sentences.chinese: 被围攻的绝地武士英勇战斗，击退了曼达洛强盗。

sentences.english: The Capital City of Lordaeron goes under seige by Doomhammer. The orcs are pushed back.
sentences.chinese: 毁灭之锤看是进攻洛伦丹的首都，但是被击退。

sentences.english: Cause an environmental death or suicide using the Force-A-Nature's knockback.
sentences.chinese: 使用自然之力的击退效果造成环境死亡或自杀效果。

sentences.english: Here are 10 of the niftiest fever-busting strategies for the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 这里有10个极好的在工作场所击退发烧的策略。

sentences.english: Our soldiers beat back all the attacks of the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我们战士击退了敌人的所有进攻。

sentences.english: Our army is attacking the enemy, and hopefully will defeat them by late afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 军发起进击，有望在傍晚将其击退。

sentences.english: Rebels have been trying to fight off a counter-offensive by Gaddafi forces.
sentences.chinese: 反政府武装一直试图击退由卡扎菲部队反攻。

sentences.english: The wise whitening formula can eliminate the redundant melanin and brighten the skin.
sentences.chinese: 含智能臻白配方，击退暗沉色素，均匀提亮肤色。

sentences.english: We repelled the enemy from the shores after a long hard struggle.
sentences.chinese: 经过长时间的艰苦战斗，我们将敌人从海岸击退。

sentences.english: The war situation was inverted and the invaders were defeated.
sentences.chinese: 战局倒转了，入侵者被击退。

definition: to deliver a punishing attack/to deal a heavy blow
to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to inflict heavy losses/to inflict serious damage
